body.name: Acer Nitro XFA243Y Sbiipr 23.8” Full HD (1920 x 1080) VA Gaming Monitor | AMD FreeSync Premium Technology | 165Hz Refresh Rate | 1ms VRB | HDR 10 | 1 Display Port 1.2 & 2 HDMI 2.0 Ports,Black
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Thursday, February 15. Order within 4 hrs 20 mins
features: 23.8" Full HD (1920 x 1080) Widescreen VA Gaming Monitor | AMD FreeSync Premium Technology
Refresh Rate: 165Hz | Response Time: 1ms (VRB) | Pixel Pitch: 0.275mm
Ergonomic Tilt: -5° to 15° | Height Adjustment Range: 4.7" | Swivel: 360° | Pivot: Yes
Ports: 1 x Display Port 1.2 and 2 x HDMI 2.0 (HDMI Cable Included)
body.description: In competitive gaming, every frame matters. Introducing Acer's XFA243Y gaming monitor - the Full HD (1920 x 1080) resolution monitor that can keep up with your game play. Through AMD FreeSync Premium technology, the game’s frame rate is determined by your graphics card, not the fixed refresh rate of the monitor, giving you a serious competitive edge. Plus, users can enjoy comfortable viewing experience while gaming via flicker-less, low dimming and ComfyView display. The design saves space on your desk and lets you place multiple monitors side by side to build a seamless big-screen display. (UM.QX3AA.S03)

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Quality Visuals Crisp, true-to-life colors come alive in Full HD resolution. Movies and games appear more real and dramatic, and small details and text are clear with 1920 x 1080 resolution in a 16:9 aspect ratio.

Rapid Refresh Rate The 165Hz refresh rate speeds up the frames per second to deliver an ultra-smooth 2D motion scenes. With a rapid refresh rate of 165Hz, Acer Monitors shorten the time it takes for frame rendering, lower input lag and provide gamers an excellent in-game experience

No Screen Tearing Say “goodbye” to stuttering and tearing. With AMD FreeSync Premium, the monitor’s frames are synced with the graphics card’s frames, which eliminates screen tearing and provide the smoothest gaming experience.

Goodbye Ghosting Fast response time of 1ms enhanced gamers’ in-game experience. No matter the fast-moving action or any dramatic transitions will be all rendered smoothly without the annoying effects of smearing or ghosting.

Features HDR Ready HDR is a display technology that creates deeper levels of black and white contrast, giving you a greater level immersion through realistic image recreation. Acer HDR displays support HDR10 format. Multiple Gaming Modes Take your pick from a wide variety of gaming and non-gaming modes, each with its own unique color profile. Choose from action, racing, sports, and more! Customize all your apps to automatically run in the mode you prefer.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Must Need Monitor
reviews.reviewText: My gaming experience with the 23.8" Full HD VA Gaming Monitor has been nothing short of exceptional. This monitor has truly elevated my gaming sessions, offering a combination of impressive features that enhance both visuals and performance.The Full HD resolution of 1920 x 1080 provides crisp and detailed imagery, creating an immersive gaming environment. The widescreen VA display ensures vibrant colors and deep contrast, making every game visually stunning. The Zero-Frame design further adds to the immersive experience, minimizing distractions and maximizing the screen real estate for an expansive view.The AMD FreeSync Premium Technology has been a game-changer in eliminating screen tearing and stuttering. The 165Hz refresh rate and rapid 1ms response time (VRB) contribute to incredibly smooth and responsive gameplay. Whether engaged in fast-paced action or exploring detailed landscapes, the monitor keeps up with the demands of modern gaming.HDR 10 support adds another layer of visual enhancement, bringing out richer colors and improved contrast for a more dynamic gaming experience. The monitor's VESA Mounting Compliance (100 x 100mm) allows for flexible setup options, whether mounted on a wall or used with an adjustable arm.The ergonomic design features are a thoughtful addition. The tilt range of -5° to 15°, height adjustment up to 4.7", 360° swivel, and pivot capability offer customization for optimal viewing comfort. This adaptability caters to various gaming setups, ensuring that the monitor can be positioned according to individual preferences.Connectivity is seamless with the inclusion of 1 x Display Port 1.2 and 2 x HDMI 2.0 ports, with an HDMI cable included. This versatility allows for easy connectivity to different gaming platforms, ensuring a hassle-free setup.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This is a lot of monitor for the $$. Especially like the height adjustability. No need for a monitor stand!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 17, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Stellar Monitor for the Price
reviews.reviewText: I initially found this monitor when building my gaming PC. I saw $200 and thought I was compromising. Now, after almost 6 months of heavy use, I know this is no compromise.It does need some color tuning out of the box, but when you do, it looks amazing. The only downside I can find with the image quality is that dark colors aren't differentiated well. It can be hard to see detail in darker games, such as Control or in darker scenes in Modern Warfare.The build quality and stand are phenomenal. The stand telescopes up and down about 6 inches, and also tilts up and down quite a bit. The monitor barely rocks when disturbed. I work from home, using this monitor for 6+ hours a day for work alone, plus an extra hour - 2 hours of gaming a day. This monitor never gives me any issues - no dead pixels, no heat issues, nothing.I've used this with a Mac, Windows PC, Nintendo Switch, and PlayStation 4. All work flawlessly.Obviously, you can get a better monitor. But for the price, this is such a great monitor, definitely worth the price tag.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 6, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Best bang for your buck, i guess
reviews.reviewText: i'm happy with the purchase and i believe there's no better option on the same price range. or at least there wasn't a couple months ago when i bought it. Let it be known that i paid 119.99 USD + 8.40 USD in tax.CONS1 - 23.8 inch version doesn't actually support HDR. You can force it to work, but it looks terrible. No information about the other versions. I don't care much for HDR, but if it's advertised on the product, it should work.2 - just "good enough" build quality. It's not flimsy but some parts could have used a better treatment, specially the stand and screen borders, both are somewhat loose and feel like cheap plastic to the touch. None of that affects image quality, though.3 - DEAD PIXELS! i don't know if it came already with them from the factory or if they developed as i used the screen, but i can see quite a few dead pixels already. they are all spread across random areas so, unless you're looking directly at them, on a white background, you'll not notice them. Still, for a brand new product i expected no dead pixels at all.that's pretty much all there is for the bad.PROS1 - Let's be honest, this thing is CHEAP. you may get a 1080p monitor for that price, but not one that supports 165hz. or maybe it does, but no freesync premium, or any of the other fancy stuff this one has. This is one of the budget-friendly gaming monitor of all time.2 - easy to assemble, which doesn't really matter much for something that you'll likely assemble only once in your entire life, but it's good that it's hassle free.3 - Lots of nice-to-haves, like freesync premium, vrb and overdrive mode.4 - did i mention that it's the best bang for your buck?All in all, if you're on a budget and want a gaming monitor, this will do the trick. Do not expect superb image quality though, like you'd get from a far more expensive model. It's an honest screen (apart from the HDR advertised).

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent budget monitor
reviews.reviewText: Bought this on sale for $100 when my old Samsung monitor died. Exceptionally good quality, especially for $100. I would recommend it to others.
llego empacado de una manera seguralos ajustes que tiene el monitor son amplios tiene buena imagen lo único que recomendaría es bajar el brillo ya que de fabrica viene muy alto

reviews.reviewTitle: Buenas características por el precio, algunos extras
reviews.reviewText: En este rango de precio hay algunos monitores buenos, me parece que éste es el mas barato de una marca popular por así decirlo. El soporte incluido tiene todos los ajustes de posición que se manejan a precios mas altos (es compatible con estandar vesa para utilizar brazos para monitor y otras opciones de soporte) incluye cable displayport solamente. Considero que tiene las características importantes en un monitor de 144 hz.El panel en sí no presentó ningún problema de píxeles muertos, el brillo es más que suficiente, la pantalla tiene un acabado no brillante que evita reflejos. Los 144 hz se notan bastante (en unos juegos mas que en otros). Si juegas fps y tu computadora es lo suficientemente decente para producir por lo menos 120 cuadros por segundo, definitivamente vas a notar la diferencia al momento de apuntar o de dar giros rápidos.Como extra trae un modo de filtro de luz azul que ayuda a contrarrestar el problema de la fatiga visual (yo lo uso cuando trabajo en hojas de cálculo o cuando tengo sesiones largas de juego), soporta 3 perfiles de juego para guardar nuestras preferencias de filtro de luz azul, colores, brillo, etc.
Excelente producto, supero mis expectativas, único detalle es que Velia un poco abierta la caja
Llegó en tiempo y la entrega cuidadosa. El audio no es muy bueno. La imagen y sus configuraciones son suficientemente buenas.

Nada mal para su precio, lo compré en aprox. $2,100.00 mxn (versión 23.8"). No entrando en detalles muy técnicos, es buena opción para juego (lo uso en xbox s), trabajo y plataformas de streaming. buena resolución, colores vivos, brillo suficiente, buenos ángulos de visión, muy fácil de armar (no se ocupa desarmador), la base es giratoria, se puede ajustar la altura y un poco el ángulo horizontal y vertical. Lo que me decepcionó un poco es que la versión que compré no cuenta con altavoces ni salida de audio. En general buena y económica opción.
